TestDescription.name: PrimeFaces 5.x Expression Language injection
TestDescription.Description:
PrimeFaces is a open source User Interface (UI) component library for JavaServer Faces (JSF) based applications. Giorgio Fedon of Minded Security has found two critical vulnerabilities in the PrimeFaces 5.x implementation. [break][break]
By abusing one of these issues any user can execute arbitrary code on the application server without authentication. [ul] [li]PrimeSecret is the default hard-coded passphrase to encrypt several PrimeFaces parameters such as "pfdrid".[/li] [li]PrimeOracle is the abuse of a Padding Oracle attack against the internal crypto algorithm that decrypts several parameters such as "pfdrid".[/li] [/ul]
TestDescription.Impact: An attacker can execute arbitrary code on the application server without authentication.
TestDescription.Recommendation: Please upgrade to the latest version of PrimeFaces or install the official fix. The official fix can be found in the Web references section.

Reference.database: RCE in Oracle NetBeans Opensource Plugins
